main event: Ground radar operators observed a luminous, oval-shaped object drifting westward near Hyattsville, Maryland in 1950.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be 7-8 miles distant and 30 degrees above the horizon.
The object remained in the same general area for 33 minutes, making short, rapid movements up, down, and sideways at irregular intervals.
The object occasionally emitted a shower of sparks or pale reddish particles.
The observation was made by Mr. and Mrs. [Observer] using binoculars, and the sighting was reported at 2132R and was still visible at 2235R.
Radar contacts at Andrews Air Force Base and Washington National Airport were negative, and a pilot of an A-6 aircraft flying in the area also did not observe the object.
